name: Nil Manel
description: National flower of Sri Lanka. Blue water lily thriving in shallow ponds and marshes.

name: Rath Dun
description: Red flowering tree found in rainforest understory. Important for native bird species.

name: Kothala Himbutu
description: Woody medicinal vine used in traditional diabetes treatments.

name: Giant Fern
description: Tree fern growing up to 6m tall in moist ravines. Prehistoric species.

name: Wal Del
description: Fast-growing pioneer species with winged seeds. Stabilizes riverbanks.

name: Hin Coconut
description: Dwarf native palm species growing in swampy areas. Edible small nuts.

name: Wet Zone Orchid
description: Epiphytic orchid with purple-striped flowers. Grows on tree branches.

name: Kudu Kasa
description: Spiny medicinal shrub used for fever treatment. Prevents soil erosion.

name: Water Asparagus
description: Edible semi-aquatic plant growing in paddies and waterways.

name: Wet Zone Rattan
description: Spiny climbing palm used in furniture making. Forms dense thickets.

name: Gonakka
description: Canopy tree with buttress roots. Fruits attract monkeys and birds.

name: Mushroom Plant
description: Bioluminescent fungus growing on decaying logs. Glows at night.

name: River Bamboo
description: Clumping bamboo variety stabilizing riverbanks. Used in crafts.

name: Nelu
description: Sticky flower used in Buddhist rituals. Grows near waterfalls.

name: Wet Zone Pitcher
description: Insect-trapping plant with fluid-filled vessels. Grows in nitrogen-poor soils.

name: Kekatiya
description: Invasive water weed forming dense mats. Purple flowers.

name: Diyapara
description: Timber tree with fragrant flowers. Used in traditional boat building.

name: Moss Flower
description: Flowering moss covering rocks and tree trunks in misty areas.

name: Wet Zone Ginger
description: Wild ginger with red flower cones. Used as spice and medicine.

name: Hora
description: Dominant dipterocarp in lowland rainforest. Important timber source.

name: Water Hyacinth
description: Floating invasive species with lavender flowers. Chokes waterways.

name: Wet Zone Cinnamon
description: Wild ancestor of cultivated cinnamon. Thinner bark but more aromatic.

name: Mountain Neem
description: High-altitude variant with medicinal leaves. Natural pesticide.

name: Liana Vine
description: Thick woody vine connecting forest canopy. Monkey pathways.

name: Wet Zone Fig
description: Strangler fig with aerial roots. Keystone species for fruit bats.

name: Mossy Oak
description: Epiphyte-covered tree in cloud forests. Slow-growing hardwood.

name: Wet Zone Cardamom
description: Wild spice plant growing in forest understory. More potent than cultivated varieties.

name: Water Primrose
description: Yellow-flowered marginal plant. Important for wetland insects.

name: Kiri Gaha
description: Milky-sapped tree with poisonous fruits. Used in traditional fishing.

name: Wet Zone Moss
description: Water-retaining moss carpeting forest floors. Indicator of air quality.

name: Hinguru
description: Fragrant white flowers blooming after rain. Used in perfumery.

name: Water Trumpet
description: Submerged oxygenating plant with tubular leaves. Fish breeding ground.

name: Polpala
description: Ayurvedic herb for urinary diseases, grows in sandy soils.

name: Kohomba
description: Neem tree with insect-repellent properties. Used in traditional medicine.

name: Nawa
description: Drought-resistant tree with medicinal bark. Sacred in local rituals.

name: Katu Aththora
description: Thorny shrub with yellow flowers. Roots treat snake bites.

name: Palu
description: Evergreen tree with edible fruit. Important wildlife food source.

name: Weera
description: Hardwood tree with fire-resistant bark. Used for tool handles.

name: Divul
description: Small tree with fragrant flowers. Leaves used in traditional medicine.

name: Kumbuk
description: Riverine tree with medicinal bark. Controls soil erosion.

name: Maila
description: Woody vine with large seed pods. Used in Ayurveda for skin diseases.

name: Andara
description: Drought-tolerant tree with grey bark. Sacred to local communities.

name: Karamba
description: Fruit tree with sour berries. Rich in vitamin C.

name: Beli
description: Thorny bush with white flowers. Roots used for fever treatment.

name: Eraminiya
description: Ground cover plant with diuretic properties. Grows in rocky areas.

name: Milla
description: Timber tree with durable wood. Leaves used as fodder.

name: Kone
description: Small deciduous tree. Bark used for tanning leather.

name: Ketakela
description: Succulent plant with wound-healing properties. Grows in arid areas.

name: Divi Kaduru
description: Toxic seeds used in traditional fishing. Requires careful handling.

name: Kukul Kapuru
description: Aromatic leaves used in religious ceremonies. Natural insect repellent.

name: Wal Jak
description: Wild jackfruit with smaller fruits. Important famine food.

name: Kottamba
description: Seaside almond tree. Nuts used in traditional medicine.

name: Bovitiya
description: Small flowering plant used for eye treatments. Grows in sandy soils.

name: Mukunuwenna
description: Edible ground cover rich in iron. Tolerant to drought conditions.

name: Heen Araththa
description: Medicinal grass used for liver disorders. Found in open fields.

name: Katu Wel
description: Spicy wild pepper vine. Berries used as substitute for pepper.

name: Pitawakka
description: Drought-resistant cactus with edible fruits. Grows in rocky outcrops.

name: Kukuruman
description: Thorny bush with purple flowers. Used for fencing and erosion control.

name: Bala
description: Medicinal plant for respiratory ailments. Grows in disturbed soils.

name: Maliththan
description: Flowering tree with fragrant blossoms. Timber used for carving.

name: Sita Eliya Orchid
description: Rare high-altitude orchid with white blooms. Found in cloud forests above 1500m.

name: Nelu
description: Strobilanthes flowering shrub that blooms once every 12 years. Creates 'pink mountains' phenomenon.

name: Horton Plains Rhododendron
description: Evergreen shrub with red flowers. Endemic to montane grasslands.

name: Ceylon Tea Plant
description: Camellia sinensis var. assamica. Basis of Sri Lanka's tea industry.

name: Maha Rathmal
description: Rhododendron arboreum with crimson flowers. Grows above 1800m elevation.

name: Cloud Forest Pitcher
description: Nepenthes distillatoria. Insect-trapping plant in misty forests.

name: Hakgala Rose
description: Rosa damascena grown in Hakgala Gardens. Used in perfume production.

name: Knuckles Fern
description: Cyathea crinita. Tree fern endemic to Knuckles range cloud forests.

name: Ceylon Blue Oak
description: Memecylon spp. With distinctive blue flowers in montane forests.

name: Mountain Cardamom
description: Elettaria cardamomum. Grown in shaded high-altitude plantations.

name: Adams Peak Moss
description: Dawsonia superba. Tall moss species in pilgrimage trails.

name: Horton Plains Violet
description: Viola spp. Tiny purple flowers in montane grasslands.

name: Ceylon Cinchona
description: Quinine-producing tree introduced in 1860s for malaria treatment.

name: Patana Grass
description: Chrysopogon zeylanicus. Dominant grass in montane meadows.

name: Dwarf Bamboo
description: Arundinaria densifolia. Forms dense thickets in submontane zones.

name: Haputale Lily
description: Lilium neilgherrense. Fragrant white lily on rocky slopes.

name: Ceylon Myrtle
description: Rhodomyrtus tomentosa. Evergreen with pink berries. Important bird food source.

name: Mist Lichen
description: Usnea spp. Hair-like lichen indicating clean air quality.

name: Maha Kadol
description: Tall mangrove tree with stilt roots. Provides coastal protection.

name: Kirala
description: Beach-loving tree with edible fruit. Salt-tolerant species.

name: Lunu Warana
description: Salt-excreting mangrove shrub. Filters coastal pollutants.

name: Sea Purslane
description: Edible succulent growing in sandy beaches. Rich in minerals.

name: Kandal
description: Common mangrove with breathing roots. Vital fish breeding habitat.

name: Spinifex Grass
description: Dune-binding grass with spherical seed heads. Prevents beach erosion.

name: Beach Morning Glory
description: Trailing vine with purple flowers. Stabilizes sandy soils.

name: Thela Kola
description: Salt-tolerant fern growing in brackish waters. Used in traditional medicine.

name: Sea Hibiscus
description: Coastal shrub with yellow flowers. Leaves used for packaging.

name: Ceylon Boxwood
description: Dense coastal timber tree. Endangered endemic species.

name: Beach Bean
description: Fast-growing vine with purple flowers. Fixes nitrogen in sandy soils.

name: Mudu Kalanduru
description: Rare mangrove with pencil-like pneumatophores. Critically endangered.
